Summary From hardware to screen-based interaction, I am passionate about bringing people into the design process and designing experiences that seamlessly fit into their lives. Through observation, ethnography, scenario development to user testing of rapid prototypes, I strive to bring to life innovative solutions. 
 
With a Master's from New York University’s Interactive Telecommunications program (ITP), I have an acquired a solid understanding of programming and physical computing as it relates to interaction design. 
 
At IDEO Chicago, I had the opportunity to work across many domains and learn IDEO's famous human-centered design process first hand on projects for Ford, Walgreens and other fortune 500 companies.  
 
At San Francisco-based health startup Fitbit, I designed cross-platform experiences with physical and digital touchpoints, participating in research studies and project managing several high profile projects. I am extremely passionate about the health and wellness space and greatly improved the experience for people. 
 
On the side, I also take on creative endeavors to continue learning and making impact. Whether its creating awareness around social issues through video shorts, leading the Interaction Design Association (IxDA) chapter or working on non-profit projects relating to technology. Experience Senior Interaction Designer Mozilla January 2015  – Present (7 months) Remote from Boston area Bringing design thinking to complex issues around privacy and security on the web for the Firefox product. Senior Product Designer Fitbit Inc October 2011  –  July 2014  (2 years 10 months) San Francisco, CA Using design, behavior change principles, game theory, and dynamic interactions with data to make people engage with their body and ultimately be more healthy. (Open) 1 honor or award System and method for wireless device pairing - 9048923 Work with Fitbit on the device pairing solution for the Fitbit flex. View Fitbit Official Site for Activity Trackers & More Edit Design Consultant Rewinery October 2012  –  February 2013  (5 months) Provide UX strategy and interaction feedback for the web and mobile experience of a small wine delivery startup. Interaction Designer, Mobile Search Google May 2011  –  October 2011  (6 months) Mountain View, CA Designed mobile browser search experiences for phone and tablet devices. Focused on exploring ways to improve local search experience by designing qualitative research studies, developing design strategies for types of local searches and prototyping designs with engineering teams. Local Leader IxDA Chicago November 2009  –  April 2011  (1 year 6 months) Local chapter lead for the Chicago IxDA (interaction design organization) group. Event planning, sponsorship requests, content strategy, etc for our 500+ design community. Senior Interaction Designer IDEO January 2009  –  March 2011  (2 years 3 months) -Worked across different industry clients from health care to consumer goods to automotive to design digital experiences for mobile, web and tablets. 
 
-Participated in and led consumer research, design workshops with clients and synthesis sessions. 
 
-Created low level sketch and digital prototypes of screen interactions for internal iteration and external concept testing. 
 
-Supervised contractors to bring design concepts and wireframes to final production deliverables. 
 
-Presented design solutions and deliverables to client stakeholders. (Open) 1 project Ford Focus EV Mobile App Interactive mobile app for iOs and Android devices that helps new electric vehicle owners find charging station, see their battery, start charging their car and get rewards for smarter driving behaviors.
